title: Online Mathematics Learning Design to Enhance Digital Well-Being for [Large-Scale] Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with Basic Online Learning Tools and Foundational Knowledge in Secondary Mathematics
context.additional_context: Students access VR simulations and video conferencing via personal devices, combining real-time interaction with self-directed learning. Instructional design must address digital fatigue and time management

learning_goals: Students can explain how to maintain digital well-being by applying time management strategies in video conference-based classes.
Learners can practice concentration maintenance and fatigue mitigation techniques during the mathematical problem-solving process through VR simulation activities.
Participants can establish personalized learning plans by monitoring digital well-being indicators (e.g., screen time, engagement frequency).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
